p: The C. metuliferus and B. hispida fruit juices showed the highest iron binding ability (77.26 ± 0.39% and 48.93 ± 0.42%, respectively), whereas M. charantia showed a low iron binding ability (7.45 ± 0.28%). When combinations of fruit juices assortments were tested, the results revealed that all mixed samples had very good iron binding capacity. The M. charantia and B. hispida mixed samples exhibited an iron binding ability of 86.95 ± 0.97%, comparable with the one of 0.1 mg/mL Na 2EDTA positive control (88.02 ± 0.43%).
